Body: Description: i am able to upload file on web , it should be blocked as per our policy.
Invitation updated. Attendees: Marian Ilies, Vikas Kataria
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
What We've Learned Updated: Client added a CAP policy in place but it doesn't work as he's still able to upload content through Web browsers.
Next Steps Updated: Scheduled a remote session for investigation.

What We've Learned Updated: Client added a CAP policy in place but it doesn't work as he's still able to upload content through Web browsers.

UPDATE 

Connected remote with the client to take a look at the issue.
The way he adjusted the CAP policy was to prevent files larger than .01 KB to be uploaded but it was not working.
Turns out that he also had the option ''Apply Policy if File Size Threshold is Matched'' enabled which made the CAP policy to work only if both conditions were matched.

Disabled the option and tried again and it was working as expected.
Agreed to close the case.

What We've Learned Updated: Client added a CAP policy in place but it doesn't work as he's still able to upload content through Web browsers.

UPDATE 

Connected remote with the client to take a look at the issue.
The way he adjusted the CAP policy was to prevent files larger than .01 KB to be uploaded but it was not working.
Turns out that he also had the option ''Apply Policy if File Size Threshold is Matched'' enabled which made the CAP policy to work only if the threshold criteria was met as well, whereas he only wanted to block everything that exceeded that amount.

Disabled the option and tried again and it was working as expected.
Agreed to close the case.

Next Steps Updated: Scheduled a remote session for investigation.

UPDATE
Closing ticket as resolved.
